Let V be a tetrahedron with its centre represented by O(0, 0, 0). The bases A, C, G and T are plotted at the vertices V 1(1, 1, 1), V 2(−1, − 1, 1), V 3(1, − 1, − 1) and V 4(−1, 1, − 1), respectively. For all the line segments formed between each pair of vertices, a midpoint is regarded as follows:
M is the midpoint of AC.
K is the midpoint of GT.
R is the midpoint of AG.
Y is the midpoint of CT.
W is the midpoint of AT.
S is the midpoint of CG.
